lessons.japanese: あなたはいつか人類が月に植民すると思いますか。
lessons.indonesian: Do you think mankind will someday colonize the Moon?
We are cut from the same cloth.

lessons.japanese: 君はこの書類に署名をしさえすればよい。
lessons.indonesian: All you have to do is sign this paper.

lessons.japanese: 君の問題と僕の問題との間には類似点はない。
lessons.indonesian: I see no analogy between your problem and mine.

lessons.japanese: 君が話してくれたので、やっとこの書類の重要さがわかった。
lessons.indonesian: I hadn't recognized the importance of this document until you told me about it.

lessons.japanese: 金庫の中の書類が消えてなくなっている。
lessons.indonesian: The papers that were in the safe are gone.

lessons.japanese: 驚いたことに、その人類学者は殺人罪で告訴された。
lessons.indonesian: To my surprise, the anthropologist was accused of murder.

lessons.japanese: 究極的には宇宙飛行は全人類に有益なものとなろう。
lessons.indonesian: Ultimately, space flight will be beneficial to all mankind.

lessons.japanese: 関係書類の山をしらべていくうちに、彼らは真実をつかんだ。
lessons.indonesian: They found out truth while examining a pile of relevant documents.

lessons.japanese: 核兵器は全人類への脅威である。
lessons.indonesian: Nuclear weapons are a threat to all humanity.

lessons.japanese: 核兵器は人類の破滅以外の何ももたらさないだろう。
lessons.indonesian: Nuclear weapons will bring about nothing but the ruin of mankind.

lessons.japanese: 核兵器は人類の絶滅をもたらすかもしれない。
lessons.indonesian: Nuclear weapons may bring about the annihilation of man.
